dc_title_s: Juvenile Salmonid Abundance Monitoring: Gird Creek, Russian River, California, 1991-2001
dc_description_s: This line shapefile represents juvenile abundance monitoring that was conducted in Gird Creek (a tributary of the Russian River) to evaluate spawning success, fry or fingerling production, and juvenile survivorship as part of a larger study examining the potential effects of reclaimed water discharged to Santa Rosa Creek by the Santa Rosa Subregional Reclamation System.Provides temporal data on fish and other aquatic species abundance in multiple Russian River tributaries.
